t: Folly of the Godless, and God’s Final Triumph
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
The*pn fool has said in his heart, “There*ild is*i no God.” They*ld are corrupt, They*ld have done abominable works, There*ld is none who does good.
The*ln Lord*s looks down from heaven upon the children of men, To*ld see if there are any who understand, who seek God.
They*ld have all turned aside, They*ld have together become corrupt; There*ild is*i none who does good, No,*ld not one.
Have*ln all the workers of iniquity no knowledge, Who*ld eat up my people as*i they eat bread, And*ld do not call on the Lord?*s
There*ld they are in great fear, For*ld God is*i with the generation of the righteous.
You*ld shame the counsel of the poor, But*ld the Lord*s is*i his refuge.
Oh,*ln that the salvation of Israel would*i come*i out of Zion! When*ld the Lord*s brings back the captivity of His people, Let*ld Jacob rejoice and*i Israel be glad.
